item.title: Flytipping on Dowlas Street again, 19th September
item.description:

item.title: A circa 2m long light branch of a tree in Alexandra Rec, Penge, cracked and fell (but is still attached) just grazing the top of this black car in Alexandra Rd at about 2pm Fri 19/9/25., 19th September
item.description:
A circa 2m long light branch of a tree in Alexandra Rec, Penge, cracked and fell (but is still attached) just grazing the top of this black car in Alexandra Rd at about 2pm Fri 19/9/25. I was passing at this time and witnessed this. No persons or animals were present or caused this. The spindly branches and leaves just seem to have touched the top of the car without damaging it, so far. I did not look closely. Please make this tree safe by detaching the broken branch. This is a busy location including for children and babies in prams / pushchairs visiting the adventure playground and Recreation Ground. I have had to report this under 'parks' / 'shrub beds' as the FMS menu system does not have a direct category for emergency park tree works. Indeed, the FMS menu system claims my 'dropped pin' is not in a park, when it is! Other pop up warnings unhelpfully just offer insurance claim links, or claim no liability. Why under 'public trees' are there sub-menus about 'private trees'? Please address also these faults in FMS which have been maddening trying to report a simple issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maitland Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Idle roadwork contractors, 19th September
item.description:
Good Afternoon, I am writing to make a formal complaint about the lack of progress and ongoing disruption from the roadworks that have been going on in Kendal Street and Connaught Street for over a year. For over a year the residents of Connaught Square have been suffering from a lack of residents parking due to the removal of residents parking in Connaught Street and Kendal Street for roadworks which seem to never end. Since the beginning of September you have now in addition removed around 20% of the parking spaces in Connaught Square to use as a parking space for machinery and a dumping ground for materials causing traffic to build up both in Connaught Street and also in the Square itself . As you know the square is a one way street now its often impossible to drive round the square often a necessity due to the lack of free spaces due to the traffic queues in connaught street blocking access to the east side of the square. What's even more frustrating is that your contractors are hardly ever there if they do show up they literally only work for about 1 or 2 hours at day at most some days including today they haven’t even shown up at all. How is this remotely acceptable? I believe the works are primarily for CS3 which the vast majority of residents have objected too whilst nevertheless being forced to pay for it no doubt from our council taxes , The least the council could do is at least ensure that your contractors actually work every single day for several hours a day to finish the project and minimise the disruption. Please can whoever in the council responsible for the project get on top of your contractors and get them to work a full days work at least for five days a week with a view to finishing rather that dragging this project out for months and months . Yours sincerely, Nishat Sattar Paice 42 Connaught Square
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Carriage Drive, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
